[LOGO]

Build predictive models faster than ever before.

Syberia is a framework for quickly trying different methods in data science. Syberia supports building, debugging, testing, and deploying classifiers developed in R.

Syberia includes support for importing data, preparing data, multiple statistical modeling methodologies, exporting trained classifiers, validating the results, and deploying as a REST service. Syberia makes it easy to quickly clean up messy data, build produciton-ready predictive models, and quickly skip past the boring stuff and onto the interesting data analysis.

Getting Started

Installation instructions go here. Installation instructions go here. 

install.packages("devtools")
# Replace with actual code
devtools::install_github("syberia")
syberia::install_syberia()

Now we can start creating a model! Let's try to predict the chances of surviving the sinking of the RMS Titanic, via the Kaggle dataset. 

#TODO: ensure they're in the base directory
cd models/dev
mkdir titanic
cd titanic
